snippet.title: 'Punch the Commissioner': An oral history of the NFL Draft's most storied tradition
snippet.description:
'Punch the Commissioner': An oral history of the NFL Draft's most storied tradition by Jon Bois on Feb 13 2014, 11:50a
Every year at the NFL Draft, a player gets drafted, walks onstage, and punches commissioner Roger Goodell in the face. Here's a look back on the most time-honored tradition in football.

snippet.title: Breaking Madden: A land where 'offsides' has no meaning
snippet.description:
Breaking Madden: A land where 'offsides' has no meaning by Jon Bois on Dec 5 2013, 10:14a
Fumbles are glorious, but over the last few decades, they've been on the decline in the NFL. Let's bring them all back. All at once. And let's destroy as many rules of man and God as we need to.
